did.unittitle: Emma Garman research notes and dissertation on the history of the Wagner Free Institute of Science

bioghist.p: Emma Garman (d. 1943) was a science teacher at Wagner Junior High School in Philadelphia. She received her M.A. from the University of Pennsylvania, and her Ph.D. from Temple University.

scopecontent.p: This collection comprises Garman's research notes for her dissertation as well as copies of the finished work. The collection includes: typescript and manuscript copies of Garman's dissertation entitled "History of the Wagner Free Institute of Science and its contribution to education" (1941); Garman's thesis statement entitled "Memorial to William Wagner and his Institute, the Wagner Free Institute of Science, Philadelphia, PA., U.S.A.: with remarks upon its contributions to education" (1936); and two notebooks, which have been disbound and placed into folders. These notebooks, Book II and Book IV, contain statistics on attendance at the Wagner, notes, and transcriptions from documents in the Institute's archives. The collection also includes a Wagner family tree.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
